intro: Grammitis fasciata, commonly known as the banded spikemoss, is a fern-like plant belonging to the family Hypnaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, closely arranged leaves that often exhibit distinct color variations. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rock crevices. Its reproductive structures, known as sporophytes, are borne on the upper portions of the stems. Grammitis fasciata plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
